films.description: A compendium of the finest silent adaptations of Arthur Conan Doyle's crime tales. Restoration funded by Iron Mountain. films.title: Steve McQueen’s biopic reconstructs the courageous battle by Notting Hill’s
films.description: West Indian community against police intimidation.

films.title: Supermarionation Memories – In Conversation with Dee Anderson
films.description: The daughter of Thunderbirds creators Gerry and Sylvia Anderson presents an immersive dive into her parent's extraordinary creative world.

films.title: Tea and Sympathy
films.description: Deborah Kerr's empathetic housewife risks her marriage and reputation for a sensitive teenager tormented by rumours and the cruelty of his peers.
films.cast: Deborah Kerr, John Kerr, Leif Erickson

films.title: Terence Davies exquisitely weaves together the life and poetry of
films.description: Terence Davies exquisitely weaves together the life and poetry of Emily Dickinson.

films.description: Terence Davies’ devastatingly moving, lyrical portrait of the life of celebrated war poet Siegfried Sassoon. + But Why?

films.description: Terence Davies’ first feature is a semi-autobiographical masterpiece of fragmented memories. + Boogie* *Screening Mon 27 Oct and Sat 29 Nov only

films.description: Terence Davies’ mosaic of childhood, imagination, time and memory is one of the greatest cinematic experiences. + Home! films.title: Terence on Television
films.description: Terence Davies was full of passion and light when he talked about cinema, as this programme reveals.

films.title: Terry Jones: The Renaissance Man
films.description: This event comprises rare and memorable clips highlighting the talents of Terry Jones, with on-stage contributions from his friends, family and colleagues. films.description: An innovative hybrid documentary exploring the troubled yet inspired life of Andrea Dunbar.

films.description: Hollywood hunk Tyrone Power sails the Spanish main in this rip-roaring pirate tale.

Restored by the Criterion Collection in cooperation with The Film Foundation's World Cinema Project and the Cineteca di Bologna
films.cast: Supriya Choudhury, Anil Chatterjee, Gita Ghatak, Niranjan Ray

films.description: We screen this rarely seen documentary about The The's Matt Johnson, followed by an interview with the singer-songwriter.

films.title: The true story of Argentine socialite Camila O’Gorman and her scandalous
films.description: The true story of Argentine socialite Camila O’Gorman and her scandalous desire for a Jesuit priest, captured with empathy, heat and righteous anger. Obsession Love’s twisted relative, obsession takes root when the world will not bend to our wishes. Tales of unrequited love, impossible desires and toxic jealousy.

films.title: The Unrealised Projects of Terence Davies
films.description: Join us as we explore the range of films that Terence Davies didn’t get to make. Dear Bud: The Creative Mind of Terence Davies Edge Hill University, the repository of the Terence Davies Archive, curates a free exhibition of previously unseen materials from Davies’ personal archive and the archive of production company Hurricane Films. The exhibition will include materials from both Terence’s personal life and film career such as family letters and belongings, behind-the-scenes photos, props and

films.title: The Worlds of James Cameron
films.description: The perfect primer to a season of films by one of Hollywood's most successful, innovative and visionary filmmakers.

films.title: This classic of Black British cinema captures the struggle of young British
films.description: West Indians as they attempt to make their way through life. Restored by the BFI National Archive and The Film Foundation. Funding provided by the Hobson/Lucas Family Foundation

films.title: This dreamlike and meditative landmark of feminist cinema features
films.description: an experimental narrative structure, a revolutionary visual style and hypnotic music.

films.title: This nuanced portrait of the struggles of integration play out in this utterly
films.description: This nuanced portrait of the struggles of integration play out in this utterly original approach to the courtroom drama.

films.description: Three adventurers meet frontier chaos in Lee Man-hee’s Korean western classic.

films.title: Traumatised by a sexual assault in her youth, the wife of an Italian wine
films.description: Traumatised by a sexual assault in her youth, the wife of an Italian wine merchant balances two existences, enabled by sporadic amnesia.

films.description: A remarkable glimpse into the Kafkaesque nature of New York’s welfare system.

films.title: What better way to see this camp horror classic than on Halloween night and

films.title: Will Arnett in Conversation
films.description: Will Arnett discusses his career to date and talks about his collaboration with director Bradley Cooper on his latest film, Is This Thing On?

films.title: With James Powell, Lilith Ungerer, Hanna Schygulla, Rainer Werner Fassbinder.
films.description: + The Woman’s Film Two radical political films approach their subject matters through different yet boundary-pushing aesthetic approaches. LOVE, SEX, RELIGION, DEATH THE COMPLETE FILMS OF TERENCE DAVIES

films.title: Youth, adulthood and death are explored in the three short, introspective films

films.title: Zimmerman and curator Matthew Barrington*
films.description: A riveting portrait of life inside a large city high school, where social and moral values are handed down.

films.title: Zorn’s Lemma + intro by Laura Mulvey
